item.title: First Server - Anti Mass
item.dc:creator: @egor42 egor42
item.description:
@egor42 wrote:

I will just make it simple…

actionTimer = 20;

Put that in a object you don’t want to be massed at.

You can change 20 to what ever u want 30…40…etc

case 823: if (actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You hit the dummy!"); setAnimation(0x326); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[0]), 0); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((150*playerLevel[18]), 18); actionTimer = 20; } break;

item.title: First Server - Anti Mass
item.dc:creator: @adil adil
item.description:
@adil wrote:

Hey guys , im in the process of creating my first server, and no it isnt just leached, E.G change name,change 2 shops and say its yours… Im doing it properly but now im stuck

If found a few tuts but none of them worked like i wanted them, I found a post that contained exactly what i wanted but i cant get it to work. heres the post

OMFG YOU ROCK DUDE.

Worked like a charm =)
Posted on: August 25, 2007, 02:15:56 AM

if(sameclick >= 10) { saveasflaggedauto(sameclick); masser();

Thats a neater way to put it though, ive modifyed the public void to:

public void masser() {
System.out.println("MasserBanned");
appendToBanned(playerName);
disconnected = true;
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " has just been automatically banned for massclicking"); 
returnCode = 5;
}

helps warn other players that if they mass, they go down =)

^^ I inserted the first part under the cases for training.
and i inserted the second bit under public void , But i’m getting over 100 errors.
Maybe someone could fix the code or tell me what im doing wrong, thanks alot.

Read full topic
